field.required: Fields followed by a * are the only ones required.
field.title: OCR-D metadata form for Segementation/Layout and OCR/HTR models

heading.training_data: Detailed information about the training data

step1.title: Fill the form
step1.info: Follow the examples and note that you can always manually modify the output. This form only helps you structure the description and ensure that every item is documented.

level.title: Transcription level
level.info:
An overview of the transcription levels can be found at GT-Guidelines.

The mixed level contains transcriptions that correspond to several levels. There is no compatibility between the levels, see for example hyphenation.

To assess the transcription level, please read the GT-Guidelines

link.title: Link to default model
link.info: Provide a URL to the default model. If you only have one model, then use the url to that. If you have several models of the same type, choose one as the default.

creation.info: If you want to provide just a year (e.g. 2021), choose: 01-01-2021

cff.title: Link to a CITATION.cff file
cff.info: CITATION.cf files allow for generating quick APA citations or Bibtex ones on github for example. See:

license.title: License
license.info:
This is a non-exhaustive selection of license options.
https://choosealicense.com/ can help to find a suitable license and download the template.

format.title: Model file format
format.info: This is a non-exhaustive selection of model formats options. If none fits, use the ".*" option.

name.title: Name of the software/engine used for training

epochs.title: Epochs
epochs.info: An epoch refers to one cycle through the full training dataset.

year.info: For centuries, please prefer the use of 1200 when a dataset starts in the 13th century and 1299 when it ends in the 13th century. Dates do not need to be precise.

scripts.title: Font/Writing system
scripts.info: To ease data entry, default values are already selected. Just click on it to deselect the one you don't want.

languages.title: Language(s)
languages.info: To ease data entry, default values are already selected. Just click on it to deselect the one you don't want.

guidelines.title: Transcription guidelines
guidelines.info: Guidelines used to transcribe the resources (normalization, resolution of abbreviation, correction of mispelling, etc.)

name.title: Project's name (if different from the repository/dataset's one)
name.input: Project's name (if different from the repository/dataset's one)

download.text3: A METADATA.yml file is created in your repository. You can now paste into the metadata created.
download.text2: to the clipboard and click on this

input.src: Link to the source or a catalog description
input.software: Software use to produce the data
input.software_placeholder: You can use the following buttons to populate the field.
input.apa: We prefer APA references, which can look like the following Allport, G. W. (1930–1967). Correspondence. Gordon W. Allport Papers (HUG 4118.10), Harvard University Archives, Cambridge, MA, United States., see APA Style, but simpler formats are okay too. The link or the APA reference are sufficient but you can provide both.

desc.main:
HTR-United is a Github organization without any other form of legal personality. It aims at gathering HTR/OCR models for and transcriptions of all periods and style of writing, mostly but not exclusively in French.
It was born from the mere necessity -for projects- to possess potentiel ground truth to rapidly train models on smaller corpora.
